p: However, Ae. albopictus was responsible for the epidemic transmission of chikungunya, an alphavirus, in Italy 2007 ( Carrieri et al., 2011). Therefore, it is unlikely that at that time factor 1) - insufficient Ae. albopictus population - is the main reason for not having dengue outbreaks in Europe, unless Ae. albopictus more effectively drives transmission of chikungunya ( Paupy et al., 2009) than dengue such that the current Ae. albopictus population are sufficient to drive chikungunya but too few to trigger dengue outbreaks ( Dubrulle et al., 2009).
